key_title: Key to the species of Glyceria

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

source.author: Walsh, N.G.
source.title: Poaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons
source.citation: From: Walsh, N.G. (1994). Poaceae. In: Walsh, N.G.; Entwisle, T.J. (eds), Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons. Inkata Press, Melbourne.

leads.lead_text: Lemmas more than 5.5 mm long, acute to narrowly obtuse at apex, entire or erose
Lemmas 2.5–5 mm long, broadly obtuse or truncate, sometimes toothed at apex
Spikelets 5–10 mm long, with 4–8 florets; panicle with numerous (more than 100) spikelets
Spikelets 10–25 mm long, with 8–18 florets; panicle with fewer than 50 spikelets
Lemma nerves usually not extending to margins of the entire or irregularly indented apex; palea not exceeding lemma; leaf-blades acuminate at apex
Lemma nerves usually reaching or very nearly reaching the shallowly toothed apex; palea with 2 narrow teeth, shortly exceeding lemma; leaf-blades boat-shaped or broadly acute at apex
Leaves with conspicuous occasional septae between longitudinal veins; upper glume 5–8 mm long; lemmas entire, 6–11 mm long, acute, the midvein continued to the apex
Leaves lacking conspicuous septae between longitudinal veins; upper glume 3–4(–5) mm long; lemmas often erose, 5.5–7 mm long, mostly narrowly obtuse and the midvein terminating before the apex
